results.text:
Your weapon breaks. If it is Fine, Very Fine, magical, a firearm, or a solid crushing weapon, roll again.
If you roll this result a second time, the weapon breaks; if not, you drop it instead.

You hit yourself in the Arm or Leg. If this is an impaling, piercing, or ranged attack, roll again.
If you roll this result a second time, you hit yourself; if not, use the second result.

You hit yourself in the Arm or Leg for half damage. If this is an impaling, piercing, or ranged attack, roll again.
If you roll this result a second time, you hit yourself; if not, use the second result.
You lose your balance and can do nothing else until your next turn (not even free actions). All Active Defenses are at -2 until then.
The weapon unreadies; you must take a Ready maneuver before you can use it again.
You drop your weapon. A cheap weapon breaks (p. 485).
The weapon unreadies; you must take a Ready maneuver before you can use it again.
You lose your balance and can do nothing else until your next turn (not even free actions). All Active Defenses are at -2 until then.

* Swinging Melee Attack
Your weapon flies [[1d6]] yards from you (50% chance forward or backward). Anyone in the weapon's landing hex must roll vs. DX to avoid taking half damage from the weapon.

* All Other Cases
You drop the weapon. A cheap weapon breaks (p. 485).
You pull a muscle, temporarily "crippling" your weapon arm for 30 minutes. You don't have to drop the weapon, but cannot use it to attack or defend.

* Melee Attack
You fall down. While Prone, you are at -3 to all defenses, -4 to all melee attacks, and can only move 1 hex per turn. It takes two turns to go from Prone, to Kneeling, to Standing.

* Ranged Attack
You lose your balance and can do nothing else until your next turn (not even free actions). All Active Defenses are at -2 until then.

Your weapon breaks. If it is Fine, Very Fine, magical, a firearm, or a solid crushing weapon, roll again.
If you roll this result a second time, the weapon breaks; if not, you drop it instead.
